page.title: 01SPERNALL
page.content: This area is rural,most of the land _use being taken up in {farming}.There are 8 working farms in the region,and the land is mainly ploughed for cereal crops.There is also much improved grassland which is used for sheep and calf rearing. There are several{woodland}areas,such as Alne Wood,Morgrave Coppice and the largest wood, Spernall Park.The woods are all decidious. Settlement is very scattered,mainly in {isolated farmhouses},but there are some loosely grouped houses forming un_named{hamlets}. { Studley Church}is of Norman origin and is very much in use today as the Parish Church of Studley.{Spernall {Church},is no longer used publicly,but is still standing. The{River Arrow}flows through the area and is used for{water reclamation
